BREAST-COMPOSITION: predominantly fibroglandular breast parenchyma with areas of fatty tissue (ACR B)
FINDINGS: a small, well-defined soft opacity in the upper outer quadrant of the breast. The margins are smooth and not spiculated. No significant microcalcifications or other suspicious features observed. Requires further evaluation with biopsy to rule out malignancy (BIRADS 4A). No abnormality noted in the skin, nipple, or pectoral muscle. No axillary adenopathy.
